title: Are Fossil watches a good brand? - Quora

response.answer_text: Are Fossil watches a good brand? Fossil watches are a popular brand and also manufacture Relic, Michele, Zodiac, and Skagen watches. In addition, Fossil makes fashion watches under contract for Adidas, Burberry, Diesel, DKNY, Michael Kors, Tory Burch, Marc Jacobs, Emporio Armani, Emporio Armani Swiss Made, Armani Exchange, Karl Lagerfeld. Given the thousands of watches that pour off the assembly line Fossil becomes less manufacturer and more marketing company and subcontractor.  According to Fossil, “of the watches we procured from the Far East, approximately 59% were assembled through our two majority-owned entities. The remaining 41% of the watches we procured from Fossil East were assembled by approximately 40 unrelated factories located primarily in Hong Kong and China. Production of approximately 73% of the jewelry products we sell is sourced from one of our majority-owned entities. The remaining 27% is manufactured by approximately 20 factories located primarily in China”. It is no surprise that quality control slips when one considers the number of production facilities making products for Fossil and other fashion retailers. Regarding failures in quartz watches, Fossil leads the herd from personal experience. When you consider a watch as a gift and the watch fails that reflects poorly on you. This is why I no longer give Fossil watches as gifts. If a relative finds a watch they like made by Fossil, I look for something similar by a different maker. In the event you do not find a better deal you will probably find a better watch. I took a group of kids to the Timex watch museum in Connecticut. After wandering through the small facility, we went by the gift shop and everyone got a watch. Each child received more than a timepiece, they walked away with a watch and a memory. I felt confident that Timex was robust enough to survive what kids can dish out.

Selecting a wristwatch may not be the easiest task to complete. The number of brands and models looking back at you from numerous online stores can make your head spin. One brand that particularly keeps popping up everywhere is Fossil. This famous brand seems to have a watch for every taste, boasting collections from modest dress wristwear to flamboyant skeleton watches. Although Fossil is known as every other widespread trademark, it’s still not considered on par with famous Swiss or Japanese watch companies, attracting interest over the reliability they provide. The American company of Fossil is known for its ultra stylish and flashy watches that always catch an eye. In the 1980s, a person wishing to acquire a wristwatch had literally two options to go for a reliable but pricey classic Swiss watch, or settle with a cheap looking piece of plastic. The market had a considerable gap for attractive yet affordable timepieces that needed covering. With the arrival of Fossil in 1984, though, the stores started to fill with eye catching watches that also boasted attractive prices. Thus the stream of fashion watches we have today got an ignition precisely from the emergence of the Fossil brand. During the years, Fossil has taken the leading role in providing fashionable wristwear but is not only limited to that. All kinds of accessories, jewelry, and leathers also come from the production line of the brand. However, the watches are still their primary source of income. The lot of you may not even know that Fossil Group consists of numerous world famous fashion brands. Over the years, they’ve complemented the portfolio from topdealsonline.shop of brands with Skagen, Zodiac, Relic, Misfit, Michele Watch, and WSI. Fossil also makes licensed accessories for other recognized brands, such as Diesel, Emporio Armani, DKNY, Puma, Burberry, Michael Kors, and Armani Exchange. So, if you are an owner of a Diesel or Armani watch, you’re now aware that your timepiece has been designed, manufactured, and distributed by no other than Fossil Group. Recently, the most significant addition to Fossil’s portfolio has been Misfit.

Fossil watches are mass-produced quartz watches, and as such, they usually have a pretty good level of quality control and finishing, and they’re likely to be defect-free and to keep accurate time for years and years. They’re not built to last for decades, especially since people buying quartz watches rarely know how/when to get a watch serviced. Gaskets fail after a few years and need replacing, or you’ll do what I did: wear a Fossil diver from the mid-1990s into a pool, and ruin the thing because water was able to enter the case and movement. FOR THE MONEY (about $100), I would highly HIGHLY recommend looking at a Seiko, Orient or Citizen watch with an automatic movement and 100m water resistance rating. Seiko’s “Seiko 5” line in particular is renowned by anyone who knows about watches for providing incredible value, durable automatic movements, timeless styling and affordable maintenance & serviceability. If you want to wear a nice watch that keeps time, while communicating to the world that you care about wearing a well-made timepiece, those three brands (Seiko, Citizen and Orient) are just a fantastic place to start.

Whenever we talk about smart watches, the name Fossil comes to the front. With the latest technology and amazing features the Fossil smart watches are booming name in the watch making industry. Recently, the brand has got the license to make watches for so many other brands which are popular all over the world. Here, we present you 5 Fossil watches that can make you one step ahead.  Fossil Men’s Sport Q Explorist Smart watch FTW4000: The smart watch can do a lot of thing as it is tech-savvy as well as good-looking. The Fossil smart watches have a wide range of products including the hybrid and analog watches. For the busy lives, the smart watch plays an important role with its key functions like fitness tracker, customizing option, and smart functions that keep you connected.  Fossil Ansel FS4744: For the formal events, the particular model is a great choice. The watch comes with a rose gold streamlined bezel, white dial and black leather strap. The three chronograph sub-windows offer precise and accurate timekeeping.  Fossil The Commuter ES4333: The colour rose gold plays a fascinating role in every women’s life. The watch with streamlined case, minimal aesthetics and classy features offer a graceful design. The watch is the perfect wear in every type of moments.  Fossil Machine FS5340: First of all, the watch has a sporty design with large case, dark blue dial and wide stainless steel bracelet. The case comes in a size of 41mm that gives clear readability. The luminescent hour-minute markers and indices offer great benefits even in the darkness.  Q Grant Hybrid Ocean Blue Stainless Steel Smart watch FTW1140: The Q Grant Hybrid watch acts as an analog watch but works like the smart watch. It is equipped with fitness tracker, activity tracker, alarm clock, multiple time, and date display and Roman numeral indices. The case is embossed on the blue coloured stainless steel bracelet. The bracelet confirms the sporty attitude of the watch.

If you are looking for a watch that you plan to keep for more than five years, I would recommend to look at Seiko or Citizen. Here are some considerations that come with a brand such as Fossil: Their quality sits towards the bottom of the Low Middle End segment, which they achieve by spending the bare minimum for decent components. So you are not necessarily in for a treat… 2. They have a rather high pace of phasing new models in and phasing old ones out, which means that after three to five years it might be hard to source replacement hands or a dial for the specific model that you are purchasing. 3. They have a strong “fashion” input, which means that a model might look trendy now and outdated in five years.  Note to the reader: I mostly write about the watch industry, so if you enjoyed reading this answer and would like to learn more about this subject, please upvote and follow me on Quora. If you prefer, you can also receive notifications about my new Quora answers on this topic via Twitter, LinkedIn or Facebook. If you are looking for actionable information on managing a watch brand, I invite you to either post a question here on Quora and request my answer; or to reach out through my Quora profile. I was Head of Design at the Longines Watch Company and I now run the agency Woodshores where I work with small, medium and big watch companies on their strategy, branding and portfolio management.

I like Fossil for their leather and NATO nylon straps. So much so that I just put them on my Hamilton watch. But would I recommend their watches to anybody? Probably not. They are decent and are made as such. They might be better than Michael Kors and the other fashion brands but not by the largest of margins. I've never had the want to buy a Fossil watch. However, I do like the wallets from Fossil. They are a really nice product. I'm sure their other leather goods are of equal quality.

Depends on you, what type of person are you? If you just want an instrument that will tell you the time, as cheap as possible, don't care about longevity and rotate watches every other day - it will get the job done. And if you are passionate about watches: do you like quality and are willing to pay for it ?Are you looking for a watch that is repairable and that will last for many years up to a life time?Do you think quality is better then quantity?Do you wish to have a watch that will retain its value for a possible resell in the future ? (So your watch is like a bank deposit that you use to tell the time until you decide to sell it- if ever!)If so, don't waste your time and money on cheaply made (and sold for 50x more profit) Quartz watches that will die after 2–3 years (or less.. Depends) Get your self a decent mechanical watch! it doesn't have to be an exotic €50K+ watch, you can pick up a beautiful Nomos Orion (35 or 38mm, with or without date) with a manual wind mechanical in-house movement for less then €3K ! mechanical Swiss/German watches will last more then a life time with the right caring. If you are really right on the budget, you can look for a Japanese Seiko 5 automatic or a Seiko diver automatic - but buy only the used vintage models since they have the “old” and better movements (today Seiko put plastic parts in some of their automatic movements which is a shame) Good luck

Compatible with IPhone. Great watch. A long Time IPhone and Apple Smartwatch user, I got the Fossil made, Emporio Armani Watch. Did so after reading they were compatible with the IPhone. Does not have a speaker, so you can’t talk on it. Otherwise, a great looking watch that works great. Fully compatible with almost all of my critical IPhone functions. So yes. It does work great with my Iphone. Many customizable faces. Functions important to me work well. Heart rate, steps, weather, texts, Gmail, current news, most others. I wanted stainless steel, and this cost half the price of the Apple stainless steel watch, and is much more attractive. Quality leather band on mine.

It's a good brand considering the price from Amazon or other online stores.  Buying it from fossil itself is always expensive. I refer fossil to someone who is just getting into watchs as a hobby. But now there are so many other options like Triwia, Braun, Ted baker, vintage Sieko and Orient. All are between 100-400$ range and better than fossil in brand name. However fossil got some of the best leather straps in business.

Last year I got a new Fossil watch. Keeps time well, synchronizes with my Google Pixel phone without fail. I find this watch to be better in comparison to the Samsung S2 (I am not a fan). Navigating the menus and apps is clean on the Fossil Q as well. Also, they regularly have great discount offers available to save you a bit of money on your Fossil order. They are posted online and you can see them on their website at http://savemoneyoff.com/fossil Hope this helps anyway, I definitely would recommend them as a good brand.

Fossil are indeed a good watch brand. They do a large variety of nice looking and well built watches at varying price ranges. Fossil brands also include Zodiac and Skagen and the company also make watches for: Emporio Armani, DKNY, Michael Kors, Marc Jacobs, Burberry & Adidas.

Personally, I would avoid smartwatches wherever you can. If you have a sporty, outdoor lifestyle and that you feel you don't need a dress watch for everyday usage, a Fossil smartwatch may be perfect for you. However, if you are in a suit all day or you have a professional working environment, I would recommend going with a more dressier watch. This does not have to be a brand new Vacheron Constantin but something that resembles your working environment. Like I say, it depends on your lifestyle - and if you are going to buy a watch, make sure you love it. You have to love it before anyone else does. Hope this helped!

They are a medium brand. As in part luxury / part average brand. It’s not a Rolex, but it’s also pricey depending on the model. I’d recommend SEIKO over them or even Citizen. My point of view. Fossil is a mid tier watch maker. Some are good some are bad.

My brother owns several and he seems to like them. They have always been reliable watches for him. In that regard, they are a “good brand.” For me, they’re just another overpriced fashion watch brand. Their quality isn’t the greatest compared to the price that they are asking. The fact that they are always running a 50%+ off sale is always telling for me.
What does “good” mean to you? They have many models, stylish and tell the time. If you like them, go with it and don’t worry about other people’s opinions of your watch.

Fossil is basically a fashion brand that makes watches which are apt for the contemporary and fashion-conscious watch users. Fossil is fashion business not watchmaking. Very fancy design. Solid Japanese movements inside, assembled somewhere, where production cost are cheapest. Buy it if you like it. It looks pretty and tells You the right time. But Your money is gone.
If style is what youre looking for, then yes its okay. But if you want quality and value for money, get a Seiko or Citizen.
